name: art history and artistic movements [not important]

children.name: Realism
children.definition: realism/ ˈrɪəlɪzəm /nounchủ nghĩa hiện thực
examples: (alsoRealism) the style of art and literature in which things, especially unpleasant things, are shown or described as they really are in life
the tough realism of his early works
realismnoun[ U ]ART
specializedpaintings, films, books, etc. that try to represent life as it really is
The anti-drugs adverts used hand-held camera techniques to add to thegrittyrealism of the situations.

children.name: naturalism
children.definition: / ˈnætʃərəlɪzəm /noun
examples: a style of art or literature which tries to show the world and people exactly as they are
Naturalismnoun[ U ]trường phái tự nhiên
(in art and literature) showing people and experiences as they really are, instead of suggesting that they are better than they really are or representing them in a fixed style
Strindberg, Ibsen and Chekhov are a few of
the dramatists who were influenced by Naturalism.
Naturalisticadjective
Naturalistic art, literature, acting, etc. shows things as they really are.
naturalisticadjective
similar to what exists in nature
_Most zoos try to exhibit animals in naturalistic settings.

children.name: idealism
children.definition: / aɪˈdɪəlɪzəm /noun
examples: a way of using art or literature to show the world as a perfect place, even though it is not

children.name: Romanticism
children.definition: romanticism/ rəʊˈmæntəsɪzəm, rəʊˈmæntɪsɪzəm, rə- $ roʊ-, rə- /noun
examples: (alsoRomanticism) a way of writing or painting that was popular in the late 18th and early 19th century, in which feelings, imagination, and wild natural beauty were considered more important than anything else
Romanticismnoun[ U ]specialized
a style of art, music and literature that was common in Europe in the late 18th and early 19th centuries, which describes the beauty of nature and emphasizes the importance of human emotions
Romanticadjective,noun[ C ]
_Beethoven, Schumann and Chopin were leading Romantic composers.

children.name: Impressionism
children.definition: nounchủ nghĩa ấn tượng
examples: a style of painting, which began in France in the 1860s, in which the artist tries to represent the effects of light on an object, person, area of countryside, etc.
Impressionistadjective
relating to Impressionism
_Impressionist paintings
_an Impressionist painter/style

children.name: Expressionism
children.definition: nounchủ nghĩa biểu hiện( thể hiện cảm xúc một cách thái quá )
examples: a style of art, music or writing, found especially in the 1900s, which expresses people's states of mind
Expressionistadjective,noun[ C ]người theo chủ nghĩa biểu hiện
Edvard Munch's "The Scream" is a famous Expressionist painting.

children.name: Cubism
children.definition: noun chủ nghĩalập thể(sử dụng chủ yếu các hình khối để vẽ)
examples: a style of modern art in which an object or person is shown as a set of geometric shapes and as if seen from many different angles at the same time
Cubistadjective,noun[ C ]hoạ sĩ lập thể

children.name: Classicism
children.definition: nounspecializedchủ nghĩacổđiển ( thường đối lập với chủ nghĩa lãng mạn )

children.name: a style in painting, sculpture and building, based on particular standards in Greek and Roman art, which was especially popular during the 18th and 19th centuries in Europe
examples: Ingres and Delacroix were two famous exponents of Classicism.

children.name: fauvism
children.definition: / ˈfəʊvɪzəm $ ˈfoʊ- /nountrường phái dã thú ( dùng màu nguyên chất chói lọi và sự đơn giản về hình cũng như luật xa gần )
examples: a style of painting that uses pure bright colours, which was developed in the early 20th century

children.name: Surrealism
children.definition: nounspecializedchủ nghĩa siêu thực ( nổi loạn , chông lại mọi quy tắc hình thể, quy ước logic và đạo đức xã hội )
examples: a type of 20th century art and literature in whichunusual or impossible things are shown happening
Surrealistnoun[ C ] ,adjective siêu thực

children.name: Supperrealism
children.definition: chủ nghĩa cực thực(chép lại ảnh chụp phóng to thành tranh )

children.name: aesthetics
children.definition: ,US alsoestheticsnounmỹ học
examples: the formal study of art, especially in relation to the idea of beauty

children.name: figurative
children.definition: adjectiveARTbiểu trưng;tượng trưng
examples: (of a painting, drawing, etc.) representing something as it really looks, rather than in an abstract way

children.name: life
children.definition: noun plurallivesvừa nhìn vừa vẽ , chứ không phải tưởng tượng ra
examples: [ U ]specializedIn art, if you work from life, you paint, draw, etc. real people or objects usually while they are in front of you rather than from memory
_life drawingclasses
still lifenoun[ C or U ]pluralstill lifes
a type of painting or drawing of an arrangement of objects that do not move, such as flowers, fruit, bowls, etc.
We went to an exhibition of 17th century Dutch still lifes.

children.name: representational
children.definition: adjective tả thực
examples: showing things as they are normally seen
representational art/pictures

children.name: abstract
children.definition: adjectiveART trừu tượng
examples: describes a type of painting, drawing or sculpture which tries to represent the real or imagined qualities of objects or people by using shapes, lines and colour, and does not try to show their outer appearance as it would be seen in a photograph.
_abstract art
_an abstract painter

children.name: non-objective
children.definition: Non-Objective art takes nothing from reality. It is created purely for aesthetic reasons. The intent of Non-objective art is to use the elements and principles of art in a way that results in a visually stimulating work. It is purely that simple.

children.name: pop art
children.definition: noun nghệ thuật đại chúng (bình dân hiện đại )

children.name: a type of modern art that started in the 1960s and uses images and objects from ordinary life
examples: _Andy Warhol's pictures of soup cans are a famous example of pop art.

children.name: baroque
children.definition: adjective hoa mỹ kỳ cục; ba-rốc
examples: relating to the heavily decorated style in buildings, art and music that was popular in Europe in the 17th century and the early part of the 18th century
_baroque architecture/painters

children.name: naive art
children.definition: nghệ thuật hồn nhiên : sáng tác ngây thơ mộc mạc như trẻ con

children.name: new art
children.definition: nghệ thuật mới (chống lại chủ nghĩa lịch sử kinh điển, được áp dụng chủ yếu trong nghệ thuật trang trí, mĩ thuật ứng dụng, mĩ nghệ, mĩ phẩm)
